column5: I have seen a lot of misinformation going around about people telling others how to make surgical masks that aren't that effective, so I made a printable poster on how to make a replica of an actually functional surgical mask using similar materials and easy to do steps so more people can be safe.
column6: HEPA filters and sewing would definitely be great additions, but I wanted to make instructions everyone can afford and do.

column6: I just mentioned in a diff comment so sorry for repeating . I totally see what you are saying on one hand , on the other , my relative ( who I live with ) has MND, so if I had symptoms and I confirmed it was Coronavirus I’d have to move out as it could be deadly to him if he caught it ( pneumonia and breathing difficulties are common causes of death for MND patients ) . If it were just a flu , which I have had around him before , I wouldn’t need to move out , this seems to attack the lungs a lot more aggressively.   I think people will not want to isolate and will take risks if they can just pass it off as ‘ the flu’. Personally, having the flu changed my routine very little , maybe more fluids and no kissing / hugging , but if I tested positive for Coronavirus I’d quarantine myself as it seems more contagious and deadly to those with compromised immune systems .
